title: Wood Chip Pad Winter Feeding Area as a New Livestock Manure Management System

tasks.task: Feeding cattle on pastures during dormancy
subtasks: Discuss soil and water effects of feeding cattle on pastures during dormant period
Explain the concept of using engineered heavy use areas (outwintering pads) for wintering sites
Describe the wood chip design for outwintering pads, including drainage, aggregate stone, and gravel base
Discuss nutrient cycling and management of wood chips for animal comfort and sustainability
Address lifecycle of wood chips in the outwintering pad system
Compare costs and management practices of outwintering pads versus traditional barn wintering
Present results of storm event sampling and nutrient runoff comparison with concrete and earthen pads

tasks.task: Water and sediment loss from winter feeding areas
subtasks: Review a 24-year study on watersheds with winter feeding and summer grazing, highlighting sediment loss
Analyze precipitation and runoff events during winter feeding compared to other land uses

tasks.task: Benefits of moving cattle off pastures during dormancy
subtasks: Quantify production impacts and conservation benefits of using outwintering pads
Highlight restored pasture recovery after moving winter feed operations

tasks.task: Case study of a low-budget outwintering pad
subtasks: Describe the implementation of a wood chip pad with a septic tank-based treatment center
Explain the draining mechanism for effluent from the outwintering pad
Introduce vegetative treatment center for dispersion of waste
